content: is there anything more eye-catching than a granny square tote bag say hello to the not the high street granny square tote bag a pretty bag with a pretty big meaning check out the blog post to find out more here this is an new and improved 18 page pdf which includes photo assistance and is made using 2 strands of dk worked together materials needed yarn paintbox yarns cotton dk 100% cotton 125m 137yds 50g 1 76oz 1 ball of daffodil yellow sailor blue tea rose pillar red grass green marine blue soft fudge and melon sorbet 4 balls of vanilla cream hook 5mm stitch markers scissors darning needle a free version of the pattern and video tutorials for left and right handed can be found at https //blog bellacococrochet com/crochet-on-the-high-street-and-why-you-shouldnt-buy-it/ where you can also take a look at all the crochet on the high street this pattern challenges the true costs of high street fast fashion here you will learn to make your own version of a popular high street design whilst the accompanying blog post will provide food for thought on how much work is involved in the process you will be working with two strands of yarn held together to prepare your yarn unravel half of one ball to create two balls of equal weight pattern written in uk terms first work all of your squares before joining you will be using the join as you go jaygo method gauge rounds 1-3 measure 9 5 cm 3 75 inches rounds 1-5 measure 14 5 cm 5 75 inches completed size width 39 cm 15 25 inches approx height including handle 60 cm 23 5 inches approx crochet skills needed chain s chain s stitch s sts s double_crochet s double_crochet s insert hook into stitch yarn over pull up a loop you will have two loops on the hook yarn over pull through remaining two loops treble_crochet s treble_crochet s yarn over insert into stitch yarn over pull up a loop you will have three loops on the hook yarn over pull through two loops yarn over pull through remaining two loops jaygo starting at a corner chain-2 space work one chain remove hook from loop insert hook into corresponding chain-2sp on joining square chain 1 finish stitching corner on original square before each side cluster of 3tr remove hook from loop insert hook into corresponding space between 3tr clusters on joining square ch1 continue with 3tr on original square we do not respond to ravelry messages contact via website pattern support only offered in community group https //www facebook com/groups/bellacococollectionsandcals note this crochet pattern is provided as a digital pdf file only no physical copy of the pattern or finished item will be supplied by purchasing and downloading this pattern you agree to the following terms respect for copyright this pattern is the intellectual property of the
